subject: how to ensure only one test runs at a time?
msgSnippet: I understand that test isolation is important, but I have a need for the individual tests in my suite to run one-at-a-time:  it does not matter which one, but
messageBody:
I understand that test isolation is important, but I have a need for
the individual tests in my suite to run one-at-a-time: it does not
matter which one, but only one must run (and run to completion before
starting any other test) because each test accesses a resource that
cannot be duplicated.

Is there a clean way to instruct JUnit to run and complete one test in
the suite before running the next test? I'm required to use JUnit
3.8.1 because I cannot upgrade to Java 5 anytime soon.

Thanks!
K
